prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Terry Fawles
Description: My client. Sentenced to death 5 years ago. Escaped from custody 2 days ago.
Character 1
Name: Valerie Hawthorne
Description: Police officer and the victim. The key witness in the case against Fawles 5 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Diego Armando
Description: A hot-shot lawyer. My senior and rival at the office. A bit smug.
Character 3
Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Dubbed a genius as soon as he started as a prosecutor. Today is his court debut.
Character 4
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective in charge of the initial investigation. Still new to his position.
Character 5
Name: Melissa Foster
Description: A college student. Witnessed and photographed the incident on Dusky Bridge.
Character 6
Name: Dahlia Hawthorne
Description: Valerie's younger sister. Victim of the kidnap/murder at Dusky Bridge 5 years ago.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. It's brand-new and sparkles in the light.
Evidence 1
Name: Valerie's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed with a knife in the back. Died from blood loss between 4 and 5 PM.
Evidence 2
Name: Dusky Bridge Map
Description: Bridge located 40 feet above Eagle River. [caption] The bridge is broken midway towards the east. It connects to the parking lot towards the west. The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks. Under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed.
Evidence 3
Name: Victim's Note
Description: Confidential police materials written by the victim. [info] 

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.
Evidence 4
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the trunk of Fawles's car. [caption] The victim appears to be dead, curled up in the trunk. She was wearing a coat and no scarf. The coat is dry and clean. The trunk opener appears to be tampered.
Evidence 5
Name: Scarf
Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.
Evidence 6
Name: Witness's Photo
Description: Seems to have been taken by the witness. Click here for details. Taken by the witness. Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera
Description: Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. A small but powerful model. Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. Has a timer function.
Evidence 8
Name: Diamond
Description: A 2 million dollar gem. Used as ransom for Dahlia. Lost to Eagle River 5 years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: On the day of the incident, an unknown person phoned the sergeant and asked to meet.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Sergeant Hawthorne went to Dusky Bridge at the designated time and met with Mr. Fawles.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: And that's where she was brutally murdered, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The criminal stuffed her body into his car trunk and tried to make a getaway.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: Here's a photo of the trunk. But I don't see anything strange, do you? Anyway...
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 5
Testimony: Mr. Fawles was arrested at a police checkpoint we set up at the base of the mountain.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. Let me go through each testimony and check against the evidences.

First, looking at the testimonies from Gumshoe. Testimony 3 says that the criminal stuffed her body into the car trunk and tried to escape. The corresponding evidence is Evidence 4, the Crime Photo. The photo shows the victim in the trunk wearing a coat but no scarf, and the coat is dry and clean. However, the Scarf (Evidence 5) was found on the bridge, which is wet and muddy. So if the body was put in the trunk after the murder, the scarf should have been on her, but the photo shows no scarf. Also, the scarf being found on the bridge contradicts the idea that the body was immediately put into the trunk. Wait, but how does that relate to the testimony?

Wait, the testimony says the criminal put the body in the trunk. But the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim's coat is dry and clean, while the Scarf (Evidence 5) is wet and muddy. If the murder happened on the bridge, maybe the victim was wearing the scarf during the incident, which got muddy, but the body in the trunk has a dry coat and no scarf. That suggests the body was moved after the scarf was removed, which could mean the timeline doesn't add up. But how does this contradict the testimony?

Alternatively, looking at the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2). The bridge is broken on the east end, connected to the parking lot on the west. The view from the south to the parking lot is blocked by rocks. The witness's photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim standing near the broken end. If the body was put into the trunk, the car would be in the parking lot (west side). But the bridge is broken, so the criminal couldn't have driven across. But Testimony 3 says the criminal tried to make a getaway. How would he get the car to the bridge if the bridge is broken? Wait, the parking lot is on the west, so the car would be there. But the bridge's broken part is towards the east. So maybe the criminal could drive to the parking lot, but the bridge itself is broken. Hmm, but how does that contradict the testimony?

Wait, the testimony says the criminal stuffed the body into the trunk and tried to escape. If the bridge is broken, maybe the car couldn't leave the area except via the mountain base, where the checkpoint was. But the map says the bridge connects to the parking lot on the west. So the parking lot is accessible by road, and the checkpoint was at the base of the mountain. So the criminal would have to drive from the parking lot down the mountain, which is where he was caught. That seems plausible. Maybe not the contradiction here.

Another angle: the Victim's Note (Evidence 3) mentions meeting at 4:30 PM. Autopsy report (Evidence 1) says death between 4 and 5 PM. The witness's photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim and Fawles on the bridge. But the scarf in the photo is on the victim, but the Crime Photo shows no scarf. Wait, the witness's photo (Evidence 6) caption says the victim was wearing a scarf and hat. The Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim's coat is dry and no scarf. So the scarf was left on the bridge (Evidence 5 is the wet, muddy scarf found there). So if the body was put into the trunk immediately after the murder, the scarf should be with her. But the scarf is found on the bridge, implying it was left there. Therefore, the testimony that the criminal stuffed the body into the trunk (which would mean the body was moved from the bridge to the car) would require the scarf to be either on her or in the car. But the Crime Photo shows no scarf on the body. So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 (body put in trunk) and Evidence 4 (no scarf on body in trunk, but scarf found on bridge). Therefore, if the body was in the trunk, the scarf should have been either in the trunk or on the body. But the scarf is on the bridge, which suggests that the body was moved without the scarf, meaning perhaps the murder didn't happen as described. Therefore, Testimony 3 (body in trunk) and Evidence 4 (scarf not present) along with Evidence 5 (scarf found on bridge) contradict the testimony. Wait, but the user wants a single evidence-testimony pair. Let me check which evidence directly contradicts the testimony.

Alternatively, the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim's coat is dry. The bridge's environment under it is a sharp rock bed. If the body was placed in the trunk after being on the bridge, perhaps there would be signs of mud or water. But the coat is dry. However, the scarf found on the bridge is wet and muddy. So if the victim was on the bridge (as per the witness photo), she would have gotten the scarf wet, but her coat is dry. That might imply she wasn't on the bridge when she died, but that's more about the location. Alternatively, the contradiction could be between the Crime Photo (dry coat) and the testimony that she was killed on the bridge (where the scarf got wet and muddy). If she was killed on the bridge, her coat might be wet or muddy, but the coat in the trunk is dry. So Testimony 3 says the body was put in the trunk after murder on the bridge, but the coat is dry, contradicting that. Therefore, Evidence 4 (dry coat) contradicts Testimony 3 (murder on bridge, body put in trunk). So the pair would be Evidence 4 and Testimony 3. But wait, Testimony 3 is about the criminal stuffing the body into the trunk. The contradiction would be that the body's coat is dry, but if she was on the bridge (which might be wet, as the scarf is wet), then the coat should be wet. However, the coat is dry. Therefore, that's a contradiction. But maybe the bridge wasn't wet. Wait, the scarf is wet and muddy. So the bridge area had mud or water. If the victim was there, her coat might be wet or muddy. But in the trunk, the coat is dry. So the body couldn't have been on the bridge, then put into the trunk. Therefore, the testimony that the body was put into the trunk after the murder on the bridge is contradicted by the dry coat in the trunk. Therefore, Evidence 4 contradicts Testimony 3. Alternatively, maybe the scarf being left on the bridge is another contradiction. But the user asks for one pair. Let me check the options again.

Another possibility: Testimony 3 says the criminal put the body in the trunk and tried to escape. The Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2) says the bridge connects to the parking lot on the west. The view from the south is blocked by rocks. So if the car was in the parking lot, the bridge's broken part is towards the east. So the criminal could drive from the parking lot (west) down the mountain. But the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) says the trunk opener was tampered. If the body was put into the trunk, but the opener is tampered, maybe implying it was hard to open. But not sure. Alternatively, the map's caption says the bridge is broken midway towards the east. So the bridge's east side is broken. If the meeting was on the bridge, perhaps the murderer couldn't have come from the east. But the parking lot is west. So maybe Fawles came from the west, parked in the lot, met Valerie on the bridge. The witness photo shows them on the bridge. Then after the murder, he puts the body in the trunk (parking lot west side) and drives down the mountain, where he's caught. So maybe the map doesn't contradict that. Hmm.

Wait, the witness photo (Evidence 6) was taken by Melissa Foster. The camera (Evidence 7) has a timer function. So maybe the photo was taken using the timer, implying Melissa wasn't present? Wait, the description says "Taken by the witness." So Melissa is the witness who took the photo. But if the bridge is blocked by rocks from the south, how did she take the photo? The map's caption says the view from the south is blocked by huge rocks. So if Melissa was south of the bridge, she couldn't see the parking lot. But the photo shows the victim and Fawles on the bridge. If the bridge is viewable from the south but blocked by rocks towards the parking lot, perhaps the witness was on the north side? Or maybe the rocks block the view from the south to the parking lot, but the bridge itself is visible from the south. Wait, the caption says "The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks." So looking from the south towards the parking lot (west), the view is blocked. But the bridge itself might be visible from the south. So Melissa could have been on the south side, photographing the bridge. The bridge connects the parking lot (west) to the east, which is broken. So the victim and Fawles are on the bridge. So the witness photo is possible. Not sure if that's a contradiction.

Back to the main task. The main contradiction I think is between the dry coat in the trunk (Evidence 4) and the wet, muddy scarf (Evidence 5). The testimony (Testimony 3) says the body was put into the trunk after the murder. But if the murder happened on the bridge where the scarf got wet and muddy, the coat should also be wet or muddy. But the coat in the trunk is dry. Therefore, the body in the trunk with a dry coat contradicts the claim that she was killed on the bridge (where the scarf would have been wet). Therefore, Evidence 4 (dry coat) contradicts Testimony 3 (body put in trunk after murder on bridge). So the answer is {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}.

Alternatively, another possible contradiction is between the Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) and the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2). The photo shows the victim near the broken end of the bridge. The map says the bridge is broken midway towards the east. So if the victim was standing on the east side (broken part), she would have fallen through. But the photo shows her standing there. Therefore, perhaps the bridge wasn't broken five years ago when Dahlia's case happened, but now it's broken. Wait, the map says "Bridge unchanged for 5 years" in the Witness's Photo (Evidence 6 caption). Wait, no: the Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) caption says "Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo..." So the bridge's condition in the photo (from 5 years ago) is the same as now. But the map (Evidence 2) says the bridge is broken midway towards the east. So if the bridge in the photo is the same as now, then five years ago, the bridge was already broken. But in Dahlia's case five years ago, she was kidnapped/murdered, and the diamond was lost to Eagle River. If the bridge was broken then, how was the ransom handled? Maybe that's a different point. However, Testimony 3 says the criminal tried to escape via car. If the bridge was broken, how did he get the car there? Wait, the parking lot is on the west side, connected to the bridge. The bridge is broken towards the east. So the car would be in the parking lot (west), and the bridge leads east but is broken. So the criminal couldn't drive across the bridge. So the getaway would be via the parking lot to the west, down the mountain. So the testimony 3 says he tried to escape, which is possible via the west. So that's not a contradiction. Hmm.

Therefore, the main contradiction is the dry coat in the trunk (Evidence 4) vs. the testimony that the body was placed there after being killed on the bridge (which would likely leave the coat wet/muddy). Hence, {"evidence":4,"testimony":3}.

In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.
Evidence 7

Testimonies:

Testimony: Actually, there's an eyewitness who was there when the incident took place.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This photo was accidentally taken by the witness. It shows the vic wearing the scarf, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was drizzling that day; unfortunately, it's a little hard to see what's going on.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: Anyway, the criminal shoved the victim down from behind and stabbed her in the back!

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's tackle this problem. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's start by going through each testimony and cross-referencing with the evidence provided.

First, let's look at the testimonies from Gumshoe. Testimony 3 says, "Anyway, the criminal shoved the victim down from behind and stabbed her in the back!" And Testimony 4 adds, "...That must have been when the scarf fell off."

Now, looking at the evidence. Evidence 4 is the Crime Photo of the trunk, which mentions the victim's coat is dry and clean, but the scarf is wet and muddy. The Scarf (Evidence 5) is also described as wet and muddy. The Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim wearing the scarf and a hat, standing near the broken end of the bridge. The autopsy report (Evidence 1) states she was stabbed in the back and died between 4-5 PM. The Victim's Note (Evidence 3) mentions a meeting at 4:30 PM on the bridge, and the scarf was for identification.

So, if the criminal pushed her from behind and stabbed her, causing the scarf to fall off (Testimony 3 and 4), then the scarf should have fallen off during the attack. But the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim's coat is dry and clean, while the scarf is wet and muddy. However, the bridge's map (Evidence 2) mentions that under the bridge is a sharp rock bed. If the victim was stabbed on the bridge, the scarf falling off there would get wet from the drizzle (Testimony 2 mentions drizzle). But if the victim was then placed in the trunk, why is the coat dry? If the attack happened on the bridge in the rain, the coat should be wet. But the coat in the trunk is dry. That's a contradiction. Wait, but the scarf is wet and the coat is dry. How can that be? The scarf being wet suggests it was exposed to the rain, but the coat is dry. If the attack happened in the drizzle, the coat should be wet too. Unless the victim was under some cover. But the bridge is broken, so maybe part of it is covered? Wait, the bridge map says the view from the south is obstructed by rocks. Hmm. Alternatively, maybe the scarf fell off into the river or mud below, making it wet, while the coat stayed dry. But the bridge is 40 feet above the river. If the scarf fell off during the attack on the bridge, it would land on the bridge or fall into the river. The Crime Photo shows the scarf is found on the bridge (Evidence 5), which is wet and muddy. So the scarf got wet from the drizzle. But the coat in the trunk is dry. That suggests that after the attack, the victim was placed in the trunk, but her coat didn't get wet. But if she was attacked during the drizzle, her coat should be wet. Unless the attack happened somewhere else. Wait, the Victim's Note says the meeting was at 4:30 PM. The autopsy says time of death between 4-5 PM. The photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim on the bridge with the scarf. The Crime Photo's trunk shows her coat is dry. If she was killed on the bridge in the rain, her coat should be wet. But it's dry. That contradicts the testimony that the attack happened there in the drizzle. Therefore, the testimony about the attack happening on the bridge (Testimony 3) contradicts the evidence that the coat is dry. Because if she was on the bridge during drizzle, her coat would be wet. But the coat is dry. So the evidence (Crime Photo, Evidence 4) showing the coat is dry contradicts Testimony 3 that the attack happened there in the drizzle. Alternatively, maybe the scarf fell into the river, making it wet, but the coat stayed dry. But the bridge is 40 feet high, so if the scarf fell into the river, it would be wet. But the scarf is found on the bridge (Evidence 5), so it was on the bridge, getting wet from the drizzle. Then the coat should also be wet. But in the trunk, the coat is dry. Therefore, the testimony that the attack happened on the bridge in the drizzle (Testimony 3) is contradicted by the coat being dry in the trunk (Evidence 4). So the contradiction is between Testimony 3 and Evidence 4. But wait, the scarf is wet and muddy, but the coat is dry. That's inconsistent. So the testimony that she was attacked on the bridge in the drizzle (which would wet her coat) but the coat is dry. Therefore, Evidence 4 (Crime Photo) contradicts Testimony 3. So the answer should be {"evidence": 4, "testimony": 3}.

Wait, but let me check another angle. Maybe the attack happened elsewhere. The Victim's Note says the meeting was on "that" bridge (Dusky Bridge). The Witness's Photo shows the victim there. The map says the bridge connects to the parking lot west, with the broken part east. The photo shows the victim near the broken end. So the attack was on the bridge. But the coat is dry. If it was drizzling, the coat would be wet unless she was under cover. The bridge's structure—maybe part of it is covered? The map doesn't mention a covered bridge. So the drizzle would wet her. Therefore, the coat being dry contradicts the testimony that the attack happened there during drizzle. Therefore, Evidence 4 (coat dry) contradicts Testimony 3 (attack on bridge in drizzle). So the answer is evidence 4 and testimony 3.

Melissa:

Evidence 7

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I... I was using my camera to take some pictures of wild flowers.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 1
Testimony: Then, I noticed there were two people standing up on the suspension bridge.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 2
Testimony: Suddenly, they just started fighting!
Person: Melissa
Testimony 3

cot:
Okay, let's try to figure this out. So, the task is to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. I need to go through the provided information step by step.

First, let's list out the key points from the evidence and testimonies. The main characters involved here are Melissa Foster, who is the witness, and the victim Valerie Hawthorne. The incident happened on Dusky Bridge, which has some specific features according to the map in Evidence 2. The bridge is broken midway towards the east, connects to the parking lot west, and the view from the south is blocked by rocks. Melissa was standing to the south of the bridge when she took the photo.

Looking at the testimonies from Melissa (Testimony 0 to 6), she claims she took a photo of the crucial moment when the two people started fighting. The Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim (Valerie) wearing a scarf and hat, standing close to the broken end of the bridge, with a man in jail uniform (Terry Fawles) facing her. The photo was taken from the south, according to Melissa's caption in Evidence 2 and 6.

But wait, the map in Evidence 2 says that the view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot (west side) is obstructed by huge rocks. If Melissa was standing south of the bridge, then her view towards the west (where the parking lot is) would be blocked. However, the bridge's broken part is on the east side. The photo in Evidence 6 shows the victim on the right (east side, since the bridge is broken there) and the man on the left (west side). But Melissa is to the south, which has rocks blocking the view to the west. So how could she take a photo showing the west side of the bridge if the rocks are in the way?

Wait, the bridge connects to the parking lot towards the west. The broken part is east. The south view is blocked towards the parking lot (west). So if the victim was standing on the east (broken end), and the man on the west (toward parking lot), then Melissa, being south, would have her view of the west side blocked by the rocks. Therefore, she shouldn't be able to see the man on the west side. But the photo shows both the victim and the man on the bridge. The photo's caption says the victim is on the right (east) and the man on the left (west). But if Melissa is south, her line of sight would be towards the north. The west part of the bridge would be to her left, but the rocks block the view to the parking lot (west). So maybe the west part of the bridge isn't visible from her position. Therefore, the photo shows parts of the bridge that Melissa shouldn't be able to see, which contradicts her testimony about where she was standing.

So the contradiction is between Evidence 2 (the map showing the south view is blocked towards the west) and Testimony 3 where Melissa says she took the photo showing the crucial moment (which includes the west side of the bridge, where the man is standing). Therefore, she couldn't have taken that photo from the south due to the rocks obstructing the view. The evidence (map) and testimony (her claiming to take the photo from the south) contradict each other.

Description: Valerie's younger sister. Victim of the kidnap/murder at Dusky Bridge 5 years ago.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: Proof of my profession. It's brand-new and sparkles in the light.
Evidence 1
Name: Valerie's Autopsy Report
Description: Stabbed with a knife in the back. Died from blood loss between 4 and 5 PM.
Evidence 2
Name: Dusky Bridge Map
Description: Bridge located 40 feet above Eagle River. [caption] The bridge is broken midway towards the east. It connects to the parking lot towards the west. The view from the south of the bridge to the parking lot is obstructed by huge rocks. Under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed.
Melissa:
Umm... I was standing right over... here. [caption] I was standing to the south of the bridge.
Evidence 3
Name: Victim's Note
Description: Confidential police materials written by the victim. [info] 

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.
Evidence 4
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the trunk of Fawles's car. [caption] The victim appears to be dead, curled up in the trunk. She was wearing a coat and no scarf. The coat is dry and clean. The trunk opener appears to be tampered.
Evidence 5
Name: Scarf
Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.
Evidence 6
Name: Witness's Photo
Description: Seems to have been taken by the witness. Click here for details. Taken by the witness. Bridge unchanged for 5 years. In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera
Description: Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. A small but powerful model. Melissa Foster took the Witness's Photo with this. Has a timer function.
Evidence 8
Name: Diamond
Description: A 2 million dollar gem. Used as ransom for Dahlia. Lost to Eagle River 5 years ago.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: After he stabbed her in the back, he quickly picked her up in his arms.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 1
Testimony: Then he carried her over to the car.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 2
Testimony: I suppose that was the only way he could make sure the body stayed hidden.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 3
Testimony: The killer broke into the trunk of the stolen car and hid the body in there.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 4
Testimony: He couldn't just leave the body on top of the bridge.
Person: Melissa
Testimony 5
Testimony: Oh, I'm sorry... I'm only supposed to talk about what I saw.
Person: Melissa

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. The task is to find one pair where the evidence doesn't match the testimony.

First, let me go through each testimony and see what they claim. Then, check the evidences to see if any of them contradict those statements.

Testimony 0 from Melissa says Terry stabbed Valerie in the back and then picked her up. Evidence 1 is the autopsy report which confirms she was stabbed in the back and died between 4-5 PM. That seems consistent.

Testimony 1: He carried her to the car. Evidence 4 is the crime photo of the trunk. The victim is in the trunk, which matches the testimony of moving her to the car. But maybe there's something about the scarf? Wait, the victim's note (Evidence 3) mentions a white scarf for identification. The Scarf (Evidence 5) is blue, wet, and muddy. But the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) says the victim wasn't wearing a scarf. So if Melissa's photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim with a scarf and hat, but the crime photo shows her without a scarf, that might be a contradiction. But which testimony does that relate to?

Looking at the testimonies again. Testimony 3 says the killer broke into the trunk and hid the body. The crime photo shows the trunk opener was tampered, which aligns. But the scarf is found on the bridge, wet, while the victim's coat in the trunk is dry. So if Melissa's testimony says the body was hidden in the trunk, the scarf being on the bridge (and the victim not wearing it in the trunk) suggests that perhaps the scarf was left behind. But how does that contradict the testimony?

Wait, Testimony 0-4 are about the sequence: stabbing, carrying to the car, hiding in the trunk. The photo (Evidence 6) taken by Melissa shows the victim wearing a scarf on the bridge. But the crime photo (Evidence 4) shows her in the trunk without a scarf, and the scarf was found on the bridge (Evidence 5). So the contradiction is that the scarf was left on the bridge, but according to Melissa's testimony, the killer carried her to the car immediately after stabbing. If the scarf was left on the bridge, then maybe the body was moved without the scarf, but the testimony says he carried her as she was. Wait, but the photo (Evidence 6) shows her with the scarf during the incident. So if the killer took her to the trunk, why is the scarf found on the bridge, and she's not wearing it in the trunk? That would mean that the scarf was removed after the stabbing but before putting her in the trunk, which might contradict the testimony that he carried her immediately. However, the testimonies don't mention the scarf being removed. So perhaps the contradiction is between the scarf's location (Evidence 5) and the testimony about moving her to the trunk with the scarf on. But which testimony specifically?

Alternatively, looking at the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2). Melissa was standing to the south of the bridge, and the view to the parking lot (west) is obstructed by rocks. The bridge is broken on the east end. The witness's photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim on the right (east side, near the broken part) and Terry on the left (west side). The photo was taken from the south. But the map says the view from the south towards the parking lot (west) is blocked by rocks. So if Melissa was south of the bridge, she shouldn't be able to see the west side (parking lot) because of the rocks. But the photo shows both Terry (left/west) and Valerie (right/east). Wait, the caption on the map says the view from the south to the parking lot (west) is obstructed. So Melissa, being south of the bridge, couldn't see the west part of the bridge where Terry is standing. But in the photo, Terry is on the left (west side) and Valerie is on the east. If Melissa's position is south, then her line of sight to the west side would be blocked by rocks. Therefore, she couldn't have taken that photo showing Terry on the west side. That would mean that the photo (Evidence 6) contradicts her testimony about where she was standing and what she saw. But which testimony does that relate to?

Looking at the testimonies: Testimony 0-5 are about the sequence of events. But the contradiction here is between Melissa's claim of where she was standing (south, per Evidence 2's caption) and the content of her photo showing parts of the bridge she shouldn't be able to see. So Evidence 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) and Testimony 0 (since she says she saw the stabbing and carried her, but the photo she took would require her to have a view that's obstructed according to the map). Wait, the photo is part of the evidence (Evidence 6), and the map (Evidence 2) states that the view from the south to the parking lot (west) is blocked. The photo shows both Terry (west) and Valerie (east). If the rocks block the view of the west side from the south, then Melissa couldn't have taken that photo. Therefore, the photo's content contradicts the map's information about the obstructed view. But the testimony in question is Melissa's testimonies about what she saw. For example, Testimony 0 says she saw Terry stab her. But if she couldn't see the west part where Terry was standing, then her testimony about seeing Terry stab her is contradicted by the map's layout. Therefore, the contradiction is between the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2) and Melissa's testimonies that she witnessed the events, which the map's description makes impossible. Specifically, Testimony 0 where she claims to have seen Terry stab Valerie, but the map shows she couldn't have seen the west part where Terry was. Therefore, the pair would be Evidence 2 (map) and Testimony 0 (her initial testimony about witnessing the stabbing). But I need to check the exact testimony and evidence details.

Evidence 2's caption includes Melissa's statement: "I was standing to the south of the bridge." The map's caption says that the view from the south to the parking lot (west) is blocked by huge rocks. The parking lot is west of the bridge. So the bridge connects to the parking lot towards the west. So the west side of the bridge is near the parking lot, and the east side is the broken part. The photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim on the right (east) and Terry on the left (west). If the photo was taken from the south, and the view to the west (parking lot) is blocked, then Melissa shouldn't be able to see Terry on the west side. Therefore, the photo she took (Evidence 6) is impossible based on the map (Evidence 2). However, the question asks for a contradiction between evidence and testimony. The testimonies are about the actions (stabbing, moving to the car), but the key contradiction is that Melissa's photo shows something she shouldn't have been able to see, based on the map. But which testimony does that contradict? Let's look at Testimony 0: "After he stabbed her in the back, he quickly picked her up in his arms." If she couldn't see the west side where Terry was, then her testimony about seeing Terry stab her is impossible. Therefore, Evidence 2 (the map) contradicts Testimony 0 (Melissa's claim of witnessing the stabbing and actions). Therefore, the correct pair is Evidence 2 and Testimony 0.

Wait, maybe the photo from five years ago (Dahlia's case) shows Dahlia, but the current case's photo (Evidence 4) is of Valerie in the trunk. Hmm, this is getting a bit confusing. Let me try to parse this again.

Evidence 6: Witness's Photo. Taken by Melissa Foster, the witness. The photo shows the bridge as it was five years ago. But according to Melissa's testimonies (Testimony 2), she hadn't been to Eagle Mountain before entering college. If the photo was taken five years ago, and Melissa is a college student now, then five years ago she would have been in high school, maybe 14-16. But she says she wasn't in Eagle Mountain until she entered college, which would have been, say, two years ago. So how could she have taken the photo five years ago? That's a contradiction. So Evidence 6 (the photo) was taken by Melissa, but according to her testimony (Testimony 2), she wasn't there five years ago. Therefore, Evidence 6 and Testimony 2 contradict each other. Because if she took the photo five years ago, she must have been there then, which her testimony denies. So the answer would be Evidence 6 and Testimony 2.

But wait, looking at Testimony 2: "Until I entered college, I had never even been to Eagle Mountain before..." If she entered college, say, two years ago, then five years ago she wasn't there. So the photo taken five years ago couldn't be by her. Therefore, the contradiction is between Evidence 6 (which states Melissa took the photo) and Testimony 2 (says she wasn't there before college). So the pair is evidence 6 and testimony 2. But Evidence 6 is the Witness's Photo (number 6), and Testimony 2 is the third testimony. Wait, the testimonies are numbered 0 to 6. Testimony 2 is "Until I entered college, I had never even been to Eagle Mountain before..." So that's the key contradiction. Therefore, the correct pair is evidence 6 and testimony 2.

But the bridge's broken part is towards the east. So if she was pushed from behind, the person would have to be on the west side (since the bridge connects to the parking lot west). Maybe the bridge's height and the rocks make her survival implausible, contradicting her testimony. But that's more of a logic inconsistency rather than a direct evidence contradiction. 

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3 where she says Fawles pushed her from behind. The Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) from five years ago (if that's the case) would show their positions. Wait, but the Witness's Photo is from the current incident. Wait, the photo is taken by Melissa Foster, who is a witness in the current case. So the photo is of Valerie and Fawles on the bridge now. Therefore, it's not related to Dahlia's testimony about the past. So that photo can't contradict Dahlia's testimony. 

Another angle: The Victim's Note (Evidence 3) mentions "Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time, the whole truth must come out." But Dahlia's testimonies (Testimony 5) say she changed her identity. So if Valerie wanted the truth to come out, but Dahlia is in hiding, maybe there's a contradiction. But that's not a direct contradiction between evidence and testimony.

Wait, let's check the Scarf (Evidence 5). It's blue, wet, and muddy, found on the bridge. The note (Evidence 3) says to wear a white scarf. The Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim without a scarf. The Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim (Valerie) wearing a scarf. So there's a contradiction between the Crime Photo (no scarf) and the Witness's Photo (with scarf). But that's between two pieces of evidence, not a testimony. But the question is between evidence and testimony. 

Wait, Dahlia's Testimony 2 says that Valerie shot Fawles in the arm after the exchange. But if Valerie was the one who was killed now, perhaps there's a contradiction in who was the aggressor. But that's not directly related to evidence.

Back to the bridge structure. If Dahlia was pushed from behind (Testimony 3), then she would have fallen off the bridge into the river or onto rocks. The bridge is 40 feet high. The bridge map says under the bridge is a sharp and solid rock bed. So if she fell onto rocks, how did she survive? The diamond (Evidence 8) was lost to Eagle River, implying that the river is below. Wait, the bridge is 40 feet above Eagle River, and under the bridge is a sharp rock bed. So maybe the river has rocks. If she fell onto the rocks, surviving would be unlikely. Her testimony says she survived, but the evidence suggests the fall would be fatal. That's a contradiction between Testimony 3 and the Dusky Bridge Map (Evidence 2). Therefore, the map's description of the rock bed under the bridge contradicts her survival, hence contradicting her testimony that she survived being pushed off.

prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Terry Fawles
Description: My client. Sentenced to death 5 years ago. Escaped from custody 2 days ago.
Character 1
Name: Valerie Hawthorne
Description: Police officer and the victim. The key witness in the case against Fawles 5 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Diego Armando
Description: A hot-shot lawyer. My senior and rival at the office. A bit smug.

Name: Miles Edgeworth
Description: Dubbed a genius as soon as he started as a prosecutor. Today is his court debut.

Name: Melissa Foster

Name: Dahlia Hawthorne

Evidences:

February 14 / 1:21 PM
Fawles. 4:30 PM @ "that" bridge.
Wear white scarf for identification.

Talk to Dahlia. Tell her this time,
the whole truth must come out.
Evidence 4

Description: Worn by the victim at the time of the incident. Found on Dusky Bridge. [caption] Blue in color. The scarf is wet and muddy.

In the photo, the victim wearing a scarf and a hat is standing to the right, facing left. The victim was standing close to the broken end. A man in jail uniform and chains is facing the victim standing to the left.

Testimonies:

Person: Fawles

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. Let's go through each testimony and check the evidence.

First, looking at the testimonies by Fawles. Testimony 3 says: "Finally, one woman came. She stood front of me." So he's saying that a woman approached him on the bridge. But according to the Victim's Note (Evidence 3), there was a note that says Valerie was supposed to wear a white scarf for identification. The Witness's Photo (Evidence 6) shows the victim wearing a scarf and a hat. However, the Crime Photo (Evidence 4) shows the victim in the trunk without a scarf, and the Scarf (Evidence 5) is found on the bridge, wet and muddy. 

Wait, the note says Valerie should wear a white scarf, but the Scarf found is blue. Hmm. Wait, maybe the scarf in the photo is white? Or maybe there's a contradiction here. Let me check. The Scarf (Evidence 5) is blue, but the note says to wear a white scarf. That might be a discrepancy. But the note was written by Valerie, so maybe she intended to wear white. But the photo shows the victim (Valerie) wearing a scarf. Wait, but the Crime Photo shows the victim without a scarf. So the scarf was left on the bridge (Evidence 5), which is blue. So the note says white scarf, but the actual scarf found is blue. That's a contradiction. But which testimony does that relate to?

Alternatively, looking at Testimony 3 where Fawles says the woman (Valerie) stood in front of him. But according to the Witness's Photo (Evidence 6), the victim was standing on the broken end of the bridge. The bridge map (Evidence 2) says the bridge is broken midway towards the east, connecting to the parking lot west. The view from the south is obstructed by rocks. The witness photo shows the victim on the right (east end, broken part) and Fawles on the left (west side). So if the bridge is broken on the east end, the victim was standing near the broken part. But Fawles says in Testimony 3 that the woman stood in front of him. If he was on the west side (left in the photo), and she was on the east (right), then maybe they were on opposite sides of the broken bridge. But the bridge is broken, so they couldn't have been close. So maybe Testimony 3 where he says she stood in front of him contradicts the map and the photo. Because the bridge is broken, they couldn't have been face to face unless they were on the same side, but the photo shows them on opposite sides. Wait, the photo's caption says the victim is standing close to the broken end (east) and the man (Fawles) is on the left (west). So if the bridge is broken midway, maybe the broken part is in the middle. So the bridge is split into two parts, east and west. If the bridge is broken midway towards the east, then the west part is connected to the parking lot. So the east part is broken. So the victim is on the broken part, and Fawles is on the west side. So how could they be standing in front of each other if the bridge is broken in the middle? Unless they were on separate sides. So Testimony 3 says the woman stood in front of him, but according to the bridge's structure, they would be separated by the broken part. That's a contradiction. Therefore, Testimony 3 and Evidence 2 (the bridge map) contradict each other. Because the bridge is broken, they couldn't have stood face to face unless they were on the same side, but the photo shows them on opposite sides. So Fawles's testimony that she stood in front of him is impossible given the bridge's broken state. Therefore, the evidence is 2 (Dusky Bridge Map) and testimony 3.
